        public SubPopulation getStarPool()

        Returns:

      • setStarPool

        public void setStarPool(boolean peaks)
                 throws JEvolutionException
        Creates star pool with specific modes. The modes indicate which solutions should be stored. Only supported mode now is `peaks', where each newly found best solution is added to the pool.
        Parameters:
        peaks - store peak Individuals (if false, no pool)
        Throws:
        JEvolutionException

      • getReportLevel

        public int getReportLevel()
        Access report level.
        Returns:
        reportLevel The amount of information reported.

      • setReportLevel

        public void setReportLevel(int reportLevel)
                    throws JEvolutionException
        Change report level.
        Parameters:
        reportLevel - The amount of information reported.
        Throws:
        JEvolutionException - Invalid level.

      • getBestIndividual

        public Individual getBestIndividual()
        Gives the best Individual of the run.
        Specified by:
        getBestIndividual in interface Reporter
        Returns:
        individual with best fitness

      • setPrintWriter

        public void setPrintWriter(java.io.PrintWriter printWriter)
        Define the output sink for reports. You may set it to 'null' to suppress any output, but setting the report level to QUIET is the preferred method. For safe operation be sure to set the auto-flush flag of the PrintWriter, as long evolution runs (with detailed output, e.g., VERBOSE) may cause a large buffer space allocated by the PrintWriter.
        Parameters:
        printWriter - prints results to attached device
        See Also:
        setReportLevel(int)
